meta_description: A world-renowned 3.5-acre garden, housing a collection of succulents, both unique and beloved, as well as drought-tolerant plants from around the world.
hours_text:
## Open Wednesday – Sunday | 9AM – 4PM

### Last Garden entry is at 3:15PM

The Garden is a living museum – please stay on the pathways and respect the space.

[Get Directions](https://www.google.com/search?q=directions+to+the+Ruth+Bancroft+Garden&rlz=1C1GCEU_enUS966US967)

## Open Wednesday – Sunday | 9AM – 4PM

### Last Garden entry is at 3:15PM

The Garden is a living museum – please stay on the pathways and respect the space.

[Get Directions](https://www.google.com/search?q=directions+to+the+Ruth+Bancroft+Garden&rlz=1C1GCEU_enUS966US967)

### Accessibility

We offer reduced or free admission* through the partnerships below.

_***Only applicable for general admission during open Garden hours: Wednesday – Sunday | 9AM – 4PM. Cannot be used for after-hours events.**_
admission_text:
* Free admission for cardholder(s) during regular hours
  * Free admission for two accompanying children under 18
  * Two single-use guest passes ($30 value)
  * Weekly e-newsletter
  * 15% off retail nursery and guests’ Garden admission
  * Access to 10+ exclusive and free [member events](https://www.ruthbancroftgarden.org/series/member-events/) annually, including Garden Strolls, Member Coffees, and Visitor & Education Center Talks
  * Member pricing on events, exhibits, classes, and workshops
  * Discounted admission to our winter light show, Garden of D’Lights

  * 10% off purchases at Bay Area garden and botanical vendors including: 
    * Dry Garden Nursery
    * Terrain by Anthropologie (Walnut Creek & Palo Alto)
    * Oaktown Native Plant Nursery
    * East Bay Nature
    * Countrywood Florist
    * East Bay Nursery
  * Free reciprocal admission to 380+ public gardens across North America through the [AHS](https://ahsgardening.org/) Reciprocal Admissions Program
  * Free subscription to _Better Homes & Gardens_ and discounted digital subscription to _Fine Gardening_

  * Free admission for cardholder(s) during regular hours

  * Two single-use guest passes ($30 value)
  * Weekly e-newsletter

collections_text:
## 

## Local Non-Profit, East Bay Dry Garden and Plant Nursery

Outdoor botanical garden and retail nursery in Walnut Creek, California. We specialize in climate-adaptive plants that are well-suited to the East Bay microclimate. The plant collection includes agaves, aloes, cacti, California native plants, succulents, yuccas, and more! _Ranked “[**The Most Beautiful Garden in the World**](https://www.travelandleisure.com/ruth-bancroft-garden-walnut-creek-california-named-most-beautiful-in-world-tripadvisor-data-study-8700410)” by Tripadvisor! _

#### **_Last Garden entry is at 3:15PM_**

[Get Directions](https://www.google.com/search?q=directions+to+the+Ruth+Bancroft+Garden&rlz=1C1GCEU_enUS966US967)

## Local Non-Profit, East Bay Dry Garden and Plant Nursery

Outdoor botanical garden and retail nursery in Walnut Creek, California. We specialize in climate-adaptive plants that are well-suited to the East Bay microclimate.
